title: Company Shares of S&T Bancorp, Inc. Drops by -1.7%
text:
By Brian Donovan - Aug 2, 2015 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) has dropped 1.7% during the past week, however, the bigger picture is still very bullish; the shares have posted positive gains of 5.1% in the last 4 weeks. The shares have underperformed the S&P 500 by 2.83% during the past week but S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) has outperformed the index in 4 weeks by 3.75%. S&T Bancorp Inc. is up 16.46% in the last 3-month period. Year-to-Date the stock performance stands at 5.1%. 
The company shares have rallied 27.61% in the past 52 Weeks. On July 22, 2015 The shares registered one year high of $32.88 and one year low was seen on October 8, 2014 at $23.07. The 50-day moving average is $30.18 and the 200 day moving average is recorded at $28.71. S&P 500 has rallied 8.5% during the last 52-weeks. The company has received recommendation from many analysts. The shares have been rated as hold from 3 Wall Street Analysts. 2 analysts have suggested buy for the company. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) : On Friday heightened volatility was witnessed in S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) which led to swings in the share price. The shares opened for trading at $30.7 and hit $31.19 on the upside , eventually ending the session at $30.92, with a gain of 0.88% or 0.27 points. The heightened volatility saw the trading volume jump to 83,727 shares. The 52-week high of the share price is $32.88 and the company has a market cap of $1,076 million. The 52-week low of the share price is at $23.07 . 
Currently the company Insiders own 3% of S&T Bancorp Inc. Company shares. In the past six months, there is a change of -11.93% in the total insider ownership. Institutional Investors own 46.1% of Company shares. During last 3 month period, 0.05% of total institutional ownership has changed in the company shares. On a different note, The Company has disclosed insider buying and selling activities to the Securities Exchange, The Securities and Exchange Commission has divulged that Gibson James Thomas, director of S&T Bancorp Inc, had unloaded 25,000 shares at an average price of $31.3 in a transaction dated on July 24, 2015. The total value of the transaction was worth $782,500. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (S&T) is a bank holding company and has three wholly owned subsidiaries, S&T Bank, 9th Street Holdings, Inc. and STBA Capital Trust I. The Company also owns certain interest in Commonwealth Trust Credit Life Insurance Company. As of December 31, 2012, the Company had approximately $3.4 billion in loans and $3.6 billion in deposits. S&T Bank is a full service bank. It provides its services to its customers through offices located in Allegheny, Armstrong, Blair, Butler, Cambria, Clarion, Clearfield, Indiana, Jefferson and Westmoreland counties of Pennsylvania. It operates in three segments: Community Banking, Wealth Management and Insurance. Its Community Banking segment offers services, which include accepting time and demand deposit accounts, originating commercial and consumer loans, and providing letters of credit and credit card services. The Wealth Management segment offers discount brokerage services, services as executor and trustee under wills and deeds. SHARE
